name: Chelsea Hotel

reviews.text: The only reason why I am giving this a two is because the location hotel is nice, I love the artwork displayed in the hallway, it's historic value and I believe that some of the rooms are beautiful.
reviews.title: I guess you could say that my room had historic trash

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, my room, 722 needed help. The room itself is beautifully decorated, it is a room with pink furnishings and a black -white kitchen. Although it really needs an update since there was paint was peeling, tiles on the floor were missing, the wood from the floor was missing and the material in the room looked seriously worn. I tried to let that get to me, but as I unpacked my bags and explored further, I noticed how many issues my room had.
reviews.title: Don't let the haters scare you...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Along with those issues, here are the other issues I didn't expect from the hotel:
reviews.title: There's something about the Chelsea...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Door would not lock or shut
reviews.title: Greatest hotel in the World

reviews.text: Noticed crumpled cookies from the previous dwellers
reviews.title: Most fun hotel ever!

likes.liked: — The general atmosphere and the lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We read the reviews, but still decided it was 'for us' - largely because my partner's grandmother lived at the Chelsea in the 60s... and we decided to pay top dollar (ie, nearly $300 per night) for a good room. And very very good room it was too. Room 715, if someone wants a recommendation! Enormous for most cities, let alone NYC. Kitchenette with fridge / hob / microwave and cupboard space, huge balcony with french windows opening onto it, hardwood floors, walk-in closet, flat-screen tv, vast bathroom with fresh new tiling and mirrored cabinet, and one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept on.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for - and it can be marvellous!

likes.liked: — the funky ambiance, the amazing room, the area

reviews.title: what an experience
reviews.text: When we checked in, the friendly desk guy said it was one of their most recently refurbed rooms - and it showed. So, ask for a refurbed room, and be prepared to pay for it is my advice. Sure, the rooms for $99 look pretty crummy – but $99 in NYC? In Chelsea? What on earth do you expect?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the desk staff, I treated them with respect and found most of them responded to it well (some were tougher nuts to crack, admittedly). The maids, ditto. I smiled, and they smiled back. Yes, they didn’t replace our shampoo & soap, so I asked. Nicely. And got an armful (Yay for souvenirs!). Just as others have said, they didn’t change the bedsheets in 5 days (probably would have if I’d asked but we aren’t that grubby…) BUT we did get more clean fluffy white towels than you can shake a stick at.
reviews.title: Glorious

reviews.text: Our room was at the front of the hotel, and duh, surprise, it was noisy. For those who moan about NYC being noisy – go stay in a forest. It’s a city, for crying out loud! (I travel everywhere with earplugs). It was worth the noise to stand on the lovely balcony every night, looking up West 23rd Street at the flickering lights and taxis whizzing past.
reviews.title: Rude Staff Noisy Hotel Horrible Experience !!

reviews.text: And what an amazing ambience. The art, the oddballs, the straggly residents, the kind old ladies who spoke to me in the lobby, and oh, that astounding staircase!
reviews.title: Hotel Chelsea: an old palazzo, not a Holiday Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Chelsea. It was liking staying in a gallery for a night. We wondered around enjoying the art covering walls and the general ambienance of the hotel. A piece of New York's cultural histrory.
reviews.title: Don't miss out on staying here

reviews.text: The room we had included a kitchenette and bathroom, and although honestly the furniture and decor looked old and cheap, it all suited feel of the hotel and was confortable enough. We loved our windows opening on to a balconette with a great view of the hotel's classic neon sign.
reviews.title: Staying at the Chealsea really made our trip

reviews.text: The bakery on the corner was fantastic and the thai further down is also highly recommened.
reviews.title: Chelsea--Not For Everyone, But It Doesn't Claim to Be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's set in a great area. We were in New York visiting my brother who lives in Williamsburg and going to some friends' art shows and generally hanging out. We were right near all the art galleries and found some great little pubs and restaurants nearby. But it was the hotel that mad the trip. Great, characterful staff, amazing lobby, very clean and grand (if a bit rough around the edges in a charming way) room with lovey big windows and balcony.
reviews.title: don't change it- great atmosphere.
Unusual and Strange
reviews.text: A highlight of our stay has to be the mature lady in a silver suit in the lobby with her 4 matching dogs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Much has been written about the Chelsea Hotel but nothing compares with the actual experience. There is something magic about it. The art and history are very rich and the building is beautiful.
reviews.title: A Cultural Treasure that MUST be experienced Please don't change it.
Low-Key Getaway
reviews.text: I have visited the hotel lobby before and finally got to stay. We can't quit talking about our experiences there and want to return soon.
We want to especially thank Jerry and the rest of the staff. They made our stay memorable and interesting.
reviews.title: Unique - a landmark worth the hype!

reviews.text: The Chelsea Hotel represents those who have gone before and, hopefully, those still to follow. We live in Seattle and there was an article in our local paper about the changes at the Chelsea. It is our hope that the tradition of the Hotel does not change.
reviews.title: Unbelievable - Stayed one night and this was one night to many.
Unique!
reviews.text: Also don't miss the El Quixote next door. We were fortunate to meet a long term artist tenant of the Chelsea there.

description: The Hotel Chelsea is a world renowned residence for artists, musicians, writers, philosophers, and characters of the most singular and eccentric stripe which the imagination might conjure.
